data.title: Great view of the falls
data.text: If you want a great view of the falls from inside, check out the library. Also has a very extensive family history section and very helpful employees.

data.title: Great Downtown Library
data.text: Lots of amazing and routine resources of all kinds. This place is a downtown treasure (though parking costs either on the street or the parkade.)

data.title: Beautiful View of the Falls
data.text: If you have some time to kill downtown, you can take a seat that overlooks the Spokane Falls and read a book. Sometimes, it's nice to just take it easy there. They have a few chairs pointing at the falls. It does have the usual transient population hanging out, but it's a nice library. There is a children's learning center upstairs, so it does get loud when that is being used.

data.title: Expand your knowledge
data.text: As tourists, we had several questions about former hotels we used to stay at in the 1950s/60s and the lady who ran the Northwest Archive Room (open a limited amount of days and hours per week) was extremely helpful and was able to answer all our questions and even helped us search old newspaper articles available on the Internet through Google News. A very interesting place to spend some time while heading though Riverpark Square and downtown, as the sky-walks make everything accessible.

data.title: Great place
data.text: A beautiful place to get your books or go to a meeting.  They have an excellent genealogy floor and on Tuesdays and Thursdays there are people there to help you with your genealogy search.

data.title: Terrific Location and Best View of the Falls of Anywhere in Spokane!
data.text: The downtown branch has so much to offer!! A beautiful view of the falls and access to WIFI and great materials of all kinds. I like to stop here before meeting friends for lunch at a downtown restaurant. They have a great Friends of Library store in the basement for next to nothing purchases. There is also a connecting hallway to Nordstroms in River Park Square. How great is that!

data.title: WOW WOW and WOW!!!
data.text: Wow talk about a library!!!! They not only provide you with 90 minutes of free computer time ( in many cities it's only 30 minutes) but they accommodate you with head phones. And they bathrooms are clean ( there is a staff of cleaners who refuse to allow a mess to form or the toilet paper to run out) there is a children's area that it well kept, as is the adults area. And you can enjoy read Dr Seuss, Shakespeare, Orwell, the paper or your favorite magazine which they provide in almost mint condition and all while taking in this breath taking view.

data.title: Love the library system.
data.text:
These libraries are clean, well designed, and the staff are exceptionally helpful.  
I frequently request books from other branches and get them quickly.  I also take many of their free classes, mainly the computer oriented  one.  They are great, although too short to get into more than superficial overviews.  Easy to reserve a computer to use, and the staff is more than happy to help with any computer, e-reader, or other technical questions.  LOVE THEM!

data.title: Wonderful resource Great views
data.text: The Spokane library is a wonderful resource for spokane the staff are very helpful, and there are lots of online resources available. I particularly like the Pronunciator online language courses and  the ability to download movies and music. The Downtown branch has great views of the Spokane River gorge from the 2nd floor as well.

data.title: Online makes it way easy!
data.text: The Spokane Library has a great online system for reserving and ordering books for you. It's very convenient.

data.title: Well kept library system
data.text: Spokane does well with its library system. Lots of materials to reference and the staff is always helpful and attentive. Branches are located in convenient parts of the city and the hours of operation usually make it very easy to access the library. Nice work Spokane!
